objtitle.title: *An Allegory of the Spiritual Condition of Man*

objdescid.compdate: 1811The work is dated "1811" bottom left, although the last digit could be "2" or "3." This inscription is damaged.

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with some pen and ink (or point of a brush) outlining
objinfo.pennednumbers: noneThe work is signed and dated "P[ainte]d in [fresc]o by W.m Blake 1811" bottom left. This inscription is damaged; the final digit in the date could be "2" or "3".

provenance.name: Fitzwilliam Museum
provenance.note: Acquired at an unknown time by Thomas Butts, probably directly from Blake shortly after the work was finished; by inheritance to Thomas Butts, Jr., in 1845; Frederick J. Butts by inheritance in 1862; his widow by inheritance in 1905; sold by her in April 1906 through the Carfax Gallery to W. Graham Robertson; sold from Robertson's collection, Christie's, 22 July 1949, lot 52 (£420 to the executors of Robertson's estate and given through the National Art-Collections Fund to the Fitzwilliam Museum.
